block.p: David Brooks's essay on sperm banks (''The National Pastime,'' column, June 15) is cruel.
David Brooks's essay on sperm banks (''The National Pastime,'' column, June 15) is cruel.
Does Mr. Brooks really think that a couple with normal fertility would go through the expense, invasive procedures and emotional toll of using a sperm donor just to have smart, pretty children?

People use sperm donors for one of two reasons: they suffer from infertility or carry a serious genetic disorder. Sometimes the cause of infertility is nonmedical (single women and lesbians), but the majority of sperm bank clients are heterosexual couples with untreatable male-factor infertility.

It's true that sperm banks use creepy marketing ploys, like charging more for donors with graduate degrees. The main service they offer, however, is donor matching, in which they select a donor with features similar to those of the (nonbiological) father-to-be.
People use donors because they want to love and raise a healthy child and need help to conceive that child.
Why would anyone, conservative or liberal, have a problem with that?
